item.title: Physics-based action adventure game Rootbound announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/physics-based-action-adventure-game-rootbound-announced-for-pc

Brainlag Games, a German studio made up of former Piranha Bytes developers established in 2024, has announced Rootbound, a physics-based action adventure game about a plantling’s quest to save its home from a mysterious blight. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A physics-based action adventure about a plantling’s quest to save its home from a mysterious blight. Equipped with your sentient backpack, you venture into a broken world. Meet lost souls, solve ancient puzzles, fight dangerous monsters, and uncover the secrets of a long-forgotten civilization.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Explore the World – Every corner of the handcrafted island of Akara is filled with secrets and activities. Learn what happened to the ancient civilization that once ruled the land, and make use of their lost technology. Solve puzzles to obtain powerful weapons and valuable upgrades—they will prove useful for the challenges that lie ahead.
  • A Living Backpack – Your backpack is much more than a simple storage for items and materials. As a sentient, but silent companion, it has a mind of its own and aids you on your journey by collecting items and tossing them to you when needed—that is, if it’s in the mood. But be careful: enemies might notice its living nature and turn their attacks on it.
  • Brighten Your Path – Crystals can be found everywhere on Akara and are essential to build campfires and torches. Campfires allow you to rest, recover, and use gathered materials to prepare for the challenges ahead. Torches shine light in dark and unexplored areas and are even rumored to give you helpful magical powers.
  • Beware the Rain – When traveling through the night unprotected, the rain will come—said to be the source of the mysterious blight plaguing your home. Only the light of torches and campfires can shield you from its touch. Continuing through the rain is unwise and dangerous.
  • Survive the Void – During your travels, you’ll encounter dangerous enemies and mysterious characters who have found ways to endure the vile rain. Yet, many of the friendlier ones would surely accept the help of a resourceful traveler like you. Speak with them and decide for yourself if their cause is worth your time and support.

item.title: Cho Aniki Bakuretsu Rantou Hen coming to Switch on June 19 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/cho-aniki-bakuretsu-rantou-hen-coming-to-switch-on-june-19-in-japan

  • Switch

The high-flying one-versus-one fighting game.

Edia will release a Switch version of one-versus-one fighting game Cho Aniki Bakuretsu Rantou Hen on June 19 in Japan for 4,290 yen, the developer announced. It will be available both physically and digitally.

Cho Aniki Bakuretsu Rantou Hen first launched for Super Famicom on September 22, 1995 in Japan, followed by PC on December 16, 2014 via D4 Enterprise‘s Project EGG.

Like the Cho Aniki Collection before it, which featured the first two Cho Aniki games, the Switch port of Cho Aniki Bakuretsu Rantou Hen boasts a number of additional features, such as Sound Mode, Visual Mode, a Rewind feature, and a Screen Filter. It also includes the “commands list” display commonly featured in fighting games.

item.title: Tetris the Grand Master 4: Absolute Eye first details, gameplay, and screenshots
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/tetris-the-grand-master-4-absolute-eye-first-details-gameplay-and-screenshots

  • PC

Latest entry in puzzle game series "coming soon."

ARIKA has opened the Steam page for Tetris the Grand Master 4: Absolute Eye, which includes new footage, information, and screenshots. While previously announced as due out by the end of March, ARIKA’s update today only mentions the release date as “coming soon.”

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The action puzzle game Tetris the Grand Master first appeared in game arcades in August 1998, and became a beloved game for gamers as a Tetris game packed with addictive elements.

Then, Tetris the Absolute: The Grand Master 2 was released in 2000, and Tetris the Grand Master 3: Terror Instinct was released in 2005. The latest in the series, Tetris the Grand Master 4: Absolute Eye, ​​will be available on Steam for the first time in 20 years.

This time, Tetris the Grand Master 4: Absolute Eye offers players a deeper, more strategic Tetris experience, and the depth of the game will satisfy even experienced players. New modes have been added, and this game will test your skills to the limit, requiring precise strategy and fast play.

Of course, there are also modes that even beginners to Tetris can enjoy, and the game is so full of charm that you will find yourself retrying it over and over again.

The sound is handled by Shinji Hosoe, who is well known for the Tetris the Grand Master series. His music, full of tension and excitement, will increase the player’s concentration and make the game even more exciting.

*Players can compete against each other in local play.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Game Modes

We will introduce the game modes available in Tetris the Grand Master 4: Absolute Eye.

  • Marathon – This is a traditional Tetris mode where you compete for the highest score.
    • Operation Type: Standard.
  • Normal – This is a traditional Tetris mode where you compete to clear lines in the fastest time.
    • Operation Type: Tetris the Grand Master.
  • Asuka – This mode is recommended for intermediate players. Tetriminos will drop at top speed, so place them quickly to clear lines and compete to see how high you can level up within the time limit. Additionally, Asuka Mode comes with a backstep function. By using the rewind feature, you can revert a placed Tetrimino back to the moment before it landed and try again.
  • Master – This is a challenging mode designed for advanced players where all of your Tetris skills will be put to the test. Strive to level up as much as possible. Tetriminos will drop at maximum speed right from the start, so stack them carefully to clear lines. Use every technique at your disposal—like T-Spins and All Clears—to take on the challenge.
  • Konoha – This mode features big blocks. Every time you achieve an All Clear, you unlock a bonus illustration. Early on, a guide will appear to help you complete All Clears, and whenever you pull one off, adorable visuals will be revealed.
  • You can view all unlocked visuals in the Konoha Character Gallery. Try to unlock every character!
  • Shiranui – In this mode, you’ll face off against CPU opponents. Defeat CPUs with different strategies as you aim to conquer the highest difficulty level. When you defeat a CPU, several new levels are unlocked. Generally, the higher the difficulty (Tier), the tougher the CPU. Plus, under certain conditions, a hidden difficulty may appear…!?

item.title: Death Stranding 2: On the Beach launches June 26
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/death-stranding-2-on-the-beach-launches-june-26

  • PS5

Digital Deluxe and Collector's editions detailed.

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach will launch for PlayStation 5 on June 26 for $69.99, publisher Sony Interactive Entertainment and developer Kojima Productions announced. Pre-orders will open on March 17.

Pre-orders for any edition of the game includes an early unlock of “Custom Hologram: Quokka,” as well as “Battle Skeleton: Silver (LV1, LV2, LV3),” “Battle Skeleton: Silver (LV1, LV2, LV3),” and “Bokka Skeleton: Silver (LV1, LV2, LV3).”

The $79.99 Digital Deluxe Edition includes the in-game items “Battle Skeleton: Gold (LV1, LV2, LV3),” “Battle Skeleton: Gold (LV1, LV2, LV3),” and “Bokka Skeleton: Gold (LV1, LV2, LV3),” as well as an early unlock of the “Machine Gun (MP Bullets) LV1,” “Patch 70: Quokka,” “Patch 71: Chiral Feline,” and “Patch 72: Why Me?”

The $229.99 Collector’s Edition includes a collector’s box, a digital download of the full game, a 15-inch Magellan Man statue, a set of art cards, a letter from Hideo Kojima, a three-inch Dollman figurine, and the previously mentioned in-game items.
